quest.name: Slither Along
journal:
 Quest Sync
Quinfort is enamored with his new companion.

Valan is not sure what to make of the creature Quinfort has found, but decides to indulge his friend nonetheless. Their first task is to carry the beast to Slitherbough and away from possible danger and prying eyes. Valan finds the serpent-like creature repulsive, and Quinfort believes himself unworthy of holding it, which leaves you as the only one who can see the deed done.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level.
With the burlap sack firmly─but not too firmly, lest you upset Quinfort─in hand, you wend your way through the woods to Slitherbough.

After a frightful journey, tiptoeing past treants and overgrown beetles, you arrive safely at Slitherbough with the burlap sack. You find Valan in the corner of a cave where the shadows will hopefully offer a modicum of privacy. He suggests taking the snakelike creature out of the sack to ensure it is still in one piece.

Quinfort arrives not long after you, enthralled by what he believes to be a divine beast of the Greatwood. Valan continues to make light of the situation, but Quinfort assures him that he will save Slitherbough with the aid of the great serpent.
objectives: Receive the snake-filled sack from Quinfort.
Carry the snake-filled sack to Valan at Slitherbough.

dialogue.name: VALAN
dialogue.text: <sigh> He seems to be serious about this.

dialogue.name: TSUCHINOKO
dialogue.text: Scree!

dialogue.name: QUINFORT
dialogue.text: O great serpent, I beseech you─grant me the strength to defend the Night's Blessed, to stay the impending calamity that threatens the Greatwood.

dialogue.name: TSUCHINOKO
dialogue.text: Scree!

dialogue.name: VALAN
dialogue.text: <sigh> I can't believe this is happening. Look, if you want to keep that thing as a pet, I won't stop you, but we really should return home.

dialogue.name: QUINFORT
dialogue.text: No, you're right. To remain here any longer could place the great serpent in danger.

dialogue.name: QUINFORT
dialogue.text: But the question is, how do we transport it? I will not stand to see the great serpent debase itself, crawling on its belly like a...like a...

dialogue.name: VALAN
dialogue.text: A snake? Just pick up the damn thing and let's go.

dialogue.name: QUINFORT
dialogue.text: By the abyss, Valan, show some respect! I should be the one to carry it, but I fear I am yet unworthy of such a burden.

dialogue.name: QUINFORT
dialogue.text: But you─you could protect the great serpent from the threats of the Greatwood, be they beasts or sin eaters.

dialogue.name: VALAN
dialogue.text: And now you mean to drag Master Matoya's guest into your schemes? What will the others think when shehe walks into Slitherbough hoisting that thing about?

dialogue.name: VALAN
dialogue.text: Here, put it in this sack.

dialogue.name: QUINFORT
dialogue.text: I will do no such thing!

dialogue.name: VALAN
dialogue.text: It's clean, dry, and most importantly, you can bring it into Slitherbough unnoticed.

dialogue.name: QUINFORT
dialogue.text: Fine... Listen, Forename. The fate of the Greatwood quite literally rests in your hands. It goes without saying we can't afford any mishaps.

dialogue.name: VALAN
dialogue.text: <sigh> I suppose we've no choice but to help him. I'll go ahead and find a place to keep his pet away from prying eyes.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM03657
dialogue.text: Deliver the snake-filled sack to Valan in Slitherbough.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM03657
dialogue.text: You will have 150 seconds to complete the task. Should you fail, return to the starting location and begin anew.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM03657
dialogue.text: Be wary of attacks from enemies, which will sap your strength.

dialogue.name: TSUCHINOKO
dialogue.text: Scree!

dialogue.name: QUINFORT
dialogue.text: Tread carefully, Forename. I will follow shortly after.

dialogue.name: QUINFORT
dialogue.text: How could you forget to take the great serpent with you? This task is not to be taken lightly.

dialogue.name: VALAN
dialogue.text: Here should be safe, for now at least.

dialogue.name: VALAN
dialogue.text: Let's have another look at the great serpent, shall we?

dialogue.name: VALAN
dialogue.text: Quinfort is still at the lake? I fear leaving him alone with that thing wasn't such a good idea.

dialogue.name: VALAN
dialogue.text: If Mother finds out about this, no shadow will be dark enough to hide from her wrath.

dialogue.name: QUINFORT
dialogue.text: Good work, you two. Oh, can you believe it? The divine protector of the Greatwood here in Slitherbough.

dialogue.name: QUINFORT
dialogue.text:
“Within a sack of burlap did the champion carry the divine beast, and beneath the slithering boughs of the Greatwood did they find shelter.”
Chapter thirty-one, verse five in the Gospel of Quinfort.

dialogue.name: VALAN
dialogue.text: <sigh> Pay him no mind... He's merely referring to his dream diary.

dialogue.name: QUINFORT
dialogue.text: For the last time, it is not a diary. Have you forgotten how the gospel foretold the events of that fateful day two years ago?

dialogue.name: VALAN
dialogue.text: How can I when you remind me of it every day?

dialogue.name: QUINFORT
dialogue.text: You continue to doubt me but soon you'll see. Together, the great serpent and I will save this village, and all of the Greatwood, from oblivion!

dialogue.name: TSUCHINOKO
dialogue.text: Scree! Scree!

dialogue.name: VALAN
dialogue.text: What have we gotten ourselves into?
